summary: This document is an email discussing the U.S. energy crisis and legislative actions regarding OPEC. It critiques the inefficacy of Congress in addressing energy independence and highlights the disparity in renewable energy initiatives between the U.S. and other countries. The email includes references to various energy policies and economic conditions affecting the market.

persons.name: Michael Cembalest
persons.context: Michael Cembalest authored the email discussing energy policies and market conditions.

persons.name: Dan Arvizu
persons.role: Director of the U.S. Department of Energy's National Renewable Energy Laboratory
persons.context: Dan Arvizu is mentioned in relation to comments made about the federal government's efforts in renewable energy.

persons.name: James Schlesinger
persons.role: Former Secretary of Defense and Energy
persons.context: James Schlesinger is referenced as the chair of a task force that recommended federal funding for energy demonstration projects.

events.title: Email Discussion on Energy Crisis
events.description: Michael Cembalest discusses the U.S. energy crisis and legislative actions regarding OPEC in an email.

events.title: Eye on the Market Report
events.description: The email references a report titled 'Eye on the Market' which discusses various economic and energy issues.

keyFacts: The email critiques Congress for its ineffective energy policies and legislative actions.
It highlights the disparity in renewable energy initiatives between the U.S. and countries like Germany and Japan.
Dan Arvizu's comments indicate that the federal government is not doing enough to foster renewable energy.
James Schlesinger chaired a task force that recommended funding for energy demonstration projects, which has not been realized on a grand scale.
The email discusses the potential for energy prices to reach a breaking point later in the year.
